attributes.action: bring awareness to sufferers of pernicious anaemia which is a life-long and life threatening condition
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: sufferers of pernicious anaemia are being ignored by their health service when asking for more frequent injections.everyone is different.the government say every 2-3 months but this varies with gp to gp.some gps are sticking to the rule of every 3 months which is very wrong.as a sufferer my life is on hold for 1 month before an injection because of extreme fatigue and my gp makes me wait another month for injection which is costing the nhs approx £1.80.this is a life-long condition which needs more information to patients and more frequent blood checks as it is a blood disorder. b12  injections should be given more frequently. THERE IS NO CURE.

rejection.details: Do you mean "encourage" or "increase awareness of" rather than "awareness to"?
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
